availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
RICHARD J. OGLESBY,
STATE
SOVEREIGNTY
NATIONAL UNION
GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF ILLINOIS.
To any Sheriff, Coroner or Constable of any County in this State,--Greeting:

Whereas, It has been made known to me by the Executive authority of the State of Kentucky that Matthew Skifington stands charged in the state of Kentucky with the crime of Felony and that the said Matthew Skifington has fled from the justice of said State and taken refuge in the State of Illinois:

Now, therefore, I, RICHARD J. OGLESBY, Governor of the State of Illinois, pusuant to the Constitution and laws of the United States, and of this State, do hereby command you to arrest and apprehend the said Matthew Skifington if he be found within the limits of the State aforesaid, and cause him to be safely kept, and delivered to the custody of William Hipwell who has been duly constituted the agent of the said State of Kentucky to receive said fugitive from the justice of said State, he paying all fees and charges for the arrest and apprehension of said Matthew Skifington and make due return to the Executive Department of this State, the manner in which this writ may be executed.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF THE STATE OF ILLINOIS
STATE
SOVERIEGNTY
NATIONAL UNION
1818

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused the Great Seal of State to be hereunto affixed. Done at the City of Springfield, this 17th day of October in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty five, and of the Independence of the United States the ninetieth

Richard J. Oglesby
By the Governor:
Sharon Tyndale
Secretary of State.

State of Illinois
Peoria County ss.

I, D. A. Wheeler a constable in and for said county sand the city of Peoria did arrest, by and in pursuance of the within warrant, the within named Mathew Skifington and delivered his body and person into the custody of the withinnamed Wm Hipwell, all of which was done at the city of Peoria on the 18th day of October AD 1865.
